TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Short : Java.Lang.Number, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Lang.IComparable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Short extends Java.Lang.Number implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Lang.IComparable, class System.IDisposable
type Short = class inherit Number interface IComparable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: The Short class wraps a value of primitive type short in an object.

remarks.para: The Short class wraps a value of primitive type short in an object. An object of type Short contains a single field whose type is short.

In addition, this class provides several methods for converting a short to a String and a String to a short, as well as other constants and methods useful when dealing with a short.
<!-- Android-removed: paragraph on ValueBased

This is a value-based class; programmers should treat instances that are #equals(Object) equal as interchangeable and should not use instances for synchronization, or unpredictable behavior may occur. For example, in a future release, synchronization may fail. -->
Added in 1.1.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the value to be represented by the Short.
Docs.summary: Constructs a newly allocated Short object that represents the specified short value.

remarks.para: Constructs a newly allocated Short object that represents the specified short value.

This member is deprecated. It is rarely appropriate to use this constructor. The static factory #valueOf(short) is generally a better choice, as it is likely to yield significantly better space and time performance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string s) cil managed

Docs.param: the String to be converted to a Short
Docs.summary: Constructs a newly allocated Short object that represents the short value indicated by the String parameter.

remarks.para: Constructs a newly allocated Short object that represents the short value indicated by the String parameter. The string is converted to a short value in exactly the manner used by the parseShort method for radix 10.

This member is deprecated. It is rarely appropriate to use this constructor. Use #parseShort(String) to convert a string to a short primitive, or use #valueOf(String) to convert a string to a Short object.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if string cannot be parsed as a short value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Short Decode(string nm) cil managed

Docs.summary: Decodes a String into a Short.
Docs.returns: a Short object holding the short value represented by nm

remarks.para:
Decodes a String into a Short. Accepts decimal, hexadecimal, and octal numbers given by the following grammar:
DecodableString:
Signopt DecimalNumeral
Signopt0xHexDigits
Signopt0XHexDigits
Signopt#HexDigits
Signopt0OctalDigits
Sign:
-
+
DecimalNumeral, HexDigits, and OctalDigits are as defined in section {
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if string cannot be parsed as a short value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int16 ParseShort(string s) cil managed

Docs.param: a String containing the short representation to be parsed
Docs.summary: Parses the string argument as a signed decimal short.
Docs.returns: the short value represented by the argument in decimal.

remarks.para: Parses the string argument as a signed decimal short. The characters in the string must all be decimal digits, except that the first character may be an ASCII minus sign '-' ('\u005Cu002D') to indicate a negative value or an ASCII plus sign '+' ('\u005Cu002B') to indicate a positive value. The resulting short value is returned, exactly as if the argument and the radix 10 were given as arguments to the #parseShort(java.lang.String, int) method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if string cannot be parsed as a short value.

MemberSignature.Value: public static short ParseShort (string? s, int radix);
.method public static hidebysig int16 ParseShort(string s, int32 radix) cil managed
static member ParseShort : string * int -> int16

Docs.param: the String containing the short representation to be parsed
the radix to be used while parsing s
Docs.summary: Parses the string argument as a signed short in the radix specified by the second argument.
Docs.returns: the short represented by the string argument in the specified radix.

remarks.para: Parses the string argument as a signed short in the radix specified by the second argument. The characters in the string must all be digits, of the specified radix (as determined by whether java.lang.Character#digit(char, int) returns a nonnegative value) except that the first character may be an ASCII minus sign '-' ('\u005Cu002D') to indicate a negative value or an ASCII plus sign '+' ('\u005Cu002B') to indicate a positive value. The resulting short value is returned.

An exception of type NumberFormatException is thrown if any of the following situations occurs:
  • The first argument is null or is a string of length zero.
  • The radix is either smaller than java.lang.Character#MIN_RADIX or larger than java.lang.Character#MAX_RADIX.
  • Any character of the string is not a digit of the specified radix, except that the first character may be a minus sign '-' ('\u005Cu002D') or plus sign '+' ('\u005Cu002B') provided that the string is longer than length 1.
  • The value represented by the string is not a value of type short.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if string cannot be parsed as a short value, or radix Character.MAX_RADIX.

Docs.summary: Returns a new String object representing the specified short.
Docs.returns: the string representation of the specified short

remarks.para: Returns a new String object representing the specified short. The radix is assumed to be 10.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 ToUnsignedInt(int16 x) cil managed

Docs.param: the value to convert to an unsigned int
Docs.summary: Converts the argument to an int by an unsigned conversion.
Docs.returns: the argument converted to int by an unsigned conversion

remarks.para:
Converts the argument to an int by an unsigned conversion. In an unsigned conversion to an int, the high-order 16 bits of the int are zero and the low-order 16 bits are equal to the bits of the short argument.
Consequently, zero and positive short values are mapped to a numerically equal int value and negative short values are mapped to an int value equal to the input plus 2<sup>16</sup>.
Added in 1.8.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int64 ToUnsignedLong(int16 x) cil managed

Docs.param: the value to convert to an unsigned long
Docs.summary: Converts the argument to a long by an unsigned conversion.
Docs.returns: the argument converted to long by an unsigned conversion

remarks.para:
Converts the argument to a long by an unsigned conversion. In an unsigned conversion to a long, the high-order 48 bits of the long are zero and the low-order 16 bits are equal to the bits of the short argument.
Consequently, zero and positive short values are mapped to a numerically equal long value and negative short values are mapped to a long value equal to the input plus 2<sup>16</sup>.
Added in 1.8.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Short ValueOf(int16 s) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a Short instance representing the specified short value.
Docs.returns: a Short instance representing s.

remarks.para:
Returns a Short instance representing the specified short value. If a new Short instance is not required, this method should generally be used in preference to the constructor #Short(short), as this method is likely to yield significantly better space and time performance by caching frequently requested values.
This method will always cache values in the range -128 to 127, inclusive, and may cache other values outside of this range.
Added in 1.5.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Short ValueOf(string s) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a Short object holding the value given by the specified String.
Docs.returns: a Short object holding the value represented by the string argument

remarks.para: Returns a Short object holding the value given by the specified String. The argument is interpreted as representing a signed decimal short, exactly as if the argument were given to the #parseShort(java.lang.String) method. The result is a Short object that represents the short value specified by the string.

In other words, this method returns a Short object equal to the value of:
new Short(Short.parseShort(s))
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if string cannot be parsed as a short value.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.Short? ValueOf (string? s, int radix);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Short ValueOf(string s, int32 radix) cil managed
static member ValueOf : string * int -> Java.Lang.Short

Docs.param: the radix to be used in interpreting s
Docs.summary: Returns a Short object holding the value extracted from the specified String when parsed with the radix given by the second argument.
Docs.returns: a Short object holding the value represented by the string argument in the specified radix.

remarks.para: Returns a Short object holding the value extracted from the specified String when parsed with the radix given by the second argument. The first argument is interpreted as representing a signed short in the radix specified by the second argument, exactly as if the argument were given to the #parseShort(java.lang.String, int) method. The result is a Short object that represents the short value specified by the string.

In other words, this method returns a Short object equal to the value of:
new Short(Short.parseShort(s, radix))
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if string cannot be parsed as a short value, or radix Character.MAX_RADIX.
